reasoning: Frontend feature to build an import/migration landing page UI in analytics-dashboard, showcasing existing integrations (JIRA, ServiceNow, GitHub, GitLab) from integration-service. Reference design provided from Linear. Standard scope with 5-6 files, primarily frontend with possible backend endpoint to list integrations.

scope.notes: Frontend: Landing page component in analytics-dashboard (React + Tailwind), routing, styles. Backend: Optional endpoint in integration-service to list available integrations and their status. Standard frontend-backend interaction, not truly cross-cutting.

integrations.notes: No new external integrations. The integration-service already has JIRA, ServiceNow, GitHub, and GitLab integrations built-in. This feature provides a UI to showcase and access these existing integrations. Reference design from Linear provides clear UX guidance.

infrastructure.notes: No infrastructure changes. Pure application-level UI feature using existing services and patterns.

knowledge.notes: Analytics-dashboard has established React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS patterns. Integration-service has FastAPI patterns and existing integration endpoints. Reference design from Linear provides UX guidance. No research phase needed - standard implementation following existing patterns.

concerns: UI/UX alignment with existing ACGS2 design system
risk.notes: Low risk UI feature. Main concerns are design consistency and proper routing. No security-sensitive operations, database changes, or complex business logic.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Simple UI component with navigation/links and no security-sensitive operations. Unit tests for React components are sufficient. No database changes, auth modifications, or API signature changes.
